intro: Kaukenia dissecta, commonly known as the dissected kaukenia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its fern-like, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Kaukenia dissecta is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
